definition: take your time/take it easy
slow
slow
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: You don't have tol bust your ass all the time. 'cause life is going on.
sentences.chinese: 你不要總是那麼拼命，人生還很長，要慢慢來。

sentences.english: A good goal will never failed because of the slowly.
sentences.chinese: 一個好的目標決不會因爲慢慢來而落空。

sentences.english: He told me to take it easy, because it was no necessary to finish this work in advance.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我要慢慢來，沒有必要提前完成這項工作。

sentences.english: My doctor says I need to ease into it slowly. Cool?
sentences.chinese: 醫生說我要慢慢來，明白嗎？

sentences.english: "Corruption is still a problem, we would like to take it very slowly," he says.
sentences.chinese: “腐敗仍然是一個問題，我們想慢慢來，”他說。

sentences.english: I studied at the sports university and therefore it was step by step.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經在體育大學學習，因爲你必須一步一步慢慢來。
但這還需要我們慢慢來。

sentences.english: Take it slowly and pace yourself.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢來，走你自己的節奏。

sentences.english: Bob. B/Take your time. He called and said he would be late.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢來，他打了電話來，說會晚到。

sentences.english: Significant improvements are needed, and they can only come gradually.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要重大的改善，只能慢慢來。

sentences.english: So plenty of sex educators and therapists recommend taking your time for self-pleasure and treating yourself as well as you’d treat a partner.
sentences.chinese: 所以很多性教育者和醫生都建議慢慢來。

sentences.english: When you're ready to begin exercising, start slowly.
sentences.chinese: 你準備開始運動時，慢慢來。

sentences.english: So, Zhao Tie Zhu intends to do it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 所以，趙鐵柱打算慢慢來。

sentences.english: There is enough time. So take your time.
sentences.chinese: 時間完全足夠，所以你慢慢來吧。

sentences.english: Let's do it slowly and correctly.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們慢慢來，把它做好。

definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
it doesn't matter
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
in a word/in short/in brief
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
to get better/to improve/to get well
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to give it a try
ought to/should/must
breakfast
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
